data.title: Fixed issue 4245
data.body:
Fixed method getAnimation, now it works as described.
Related to #4245 .

data.title: Fixes loading external Tiled tilesets with relative images
data.body:
This commit fixes a bug when loading external tilesets with external images.

Consider the following directory structure:

```
root/
    tilemap.tmx [refers to tileset as "tiles/tileset.tsx"]
    tiles/
        tileset.tsx [refers to images as "tile#.png"]
        tile1.png
        tile2.png
```

Previously, it would try to load the images using the tilemap's location as a base, so it would look for images in root/tile#.png. Now, it will load from root/tiles/tile#.png as expected.

data.title: Feature for Scene2D: ImmutableList
data.body: I want to show a list of entities from a specific entity family. The entities are all placed in an immutable array and I can't set this array directly as datasource for the list. To refresh the list I only could remove all entities and add them again. An ImmutableList would be nice.

data.title: ModelInstance::getAnimation(String) inverted logic
setFlip(boolean X, boolean Y) dosent affect ParticulesEfct but flipY() does
VerticalGroup alignment issues
data.body:
#### Issue details

VerticalGroup always aligns its elements to **center** independently of the alignment setting. Seems related to https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/commit/3840e4eea50482409972fc78a60e1deb69a59250.

In addition to adding wrapping, at least VerticalGroup behaviour is different than it was on earlier libGDX versions (with wrap set to false). I use VerticalGroup/HorizontalGroup as a lightweight containers for displaying elements in a column/row that auto-sizes with the inserted elements. Now setSize() seems to be required,  if this is intended behaviour it should probably be added to the CHANGES because it breaks existing UIs that make use of them.
#### Reproduction steps/code

SSCCE
http://pastebin.com/JWiHkHwk
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.4-SNAPSHOT
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] Android
- [x] iOS (robovm)
- [x] iOS (MOE)
- [x] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [x] MacOS

data.title: FacedCubemapData native heap leak
data.body:
#### Issue details

Hi all,
I've been playing with GDX for the past months and I noticed something.
Every time I create a `FacedCubemapData` it leaks memory on the **native heap**, since there is no `dispose` method to free all 6 `Pixmap`s.
#### Reproduction steps/code

[I created a sample project to help you reproduce the problem](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/files/412000/leaktest.zip). It will leak memory every time you tap the screen.

The problematic method is this one:

``` java
    public void leak () {
        new FacedCubemapData(
                Gdx.files.internal("face.png"),
                Gdx.files.internal("face.png"),
                Gdx.files.internal("face.png"),
                Gdx.files.internal("face.png"),
                Gdx.files.internal("face.png"),
                Gdx.files.internal("face.png")
        );
    }
```

Yes, it doesn't do anything useful but it's just a proof of concept =].  
The GC will remove our `FacedCubemapData`, keeping `Pixmap`s on the **native heap**. You can check the behavior by issuing the following command:

```
adb shell dumpsys meminfo in.lucasdup.leaktest
```
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

gdxVersion = '1.9.3'
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [X] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

I've been testing this on Android but probably other platforms are also affected.

PS: I can help with a fix / pull request

data.title: Controller API Lwjgl3 Not Detecting POV Movement (DPAD)
data.body:
Right now I have my application setup to use the new lwjgl3 backend and the events for connecting and disconnecting a controller work (unlike before), but now the `povMoved` event never fires when I'm pressing on the DPAD. 

Also, I know that some events are working because the event for `axisMoved` is being triggered when I move one of the analog sticks and `buttonDown` is being triggered when any of the buttons are being hit.

Additional Info:
- Controller: Xbox One Controller
- OS: Windows 8.1 x64
- LWJGL 3 backend (and all associated Gradle dependencies needed for the Controllers extension)

EDIT:
After looking through the actual `Lwjgl3ControllerManager` class it looks like there is no event in place to handle the DPAD. The events are `connected`, `disconnected`, `axisChanged`, and `buttonChanged`. Is this going to be added?

data.title: Add freetype error codes to exceptions
data.body:
# What does this PR do?

This PR adds a way to get the error code most free type functions return.
There is currently no way to get the error code since `if(error) return 0;` hides the error code.
It's possible to know _that_ an error occurred  but not _what_ error exactly occurred.

We could create a wrapper class which contains an error code (if there is one) and the result of the function, but this would be too inefficient.
That's why I came up with this solution.

When a function returns `0` you can now check the error code via `getLastErrorCode()`.
All functions that throw an exception now include the error code.

The PR would allow easier fixing of this issue:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/3692

data.title: TexturePacker.Settings copy ctor extracted to dedicated method
data.body: `TexturePacker.Settings` has constructor with another `Settings` as param to make a copy instance. Much flexible to have this code in separate method (`Settings#set(Settings)`), to be able to copy fields from another instance anytime.

data.title: Possible BUG: Rectangle.contains does not work as expected
data.body:
Hi,

Analyzing source code of Rectangle.contains(int, int) it seems there is a problem when width and height are equal to 1. Here the code:

public boolean contains (float x, float y) {
        return this.x <= x && this.x + this.width >= x && this.y <= y && this.y + this.height >= y;
    }

Let me do an example.
Suppose I have a rectangle with x=5, y=5, width=1 and height=1. If it would be a rectangle on a screen it could be a single pixel.

Then I have the point x=5,y=6 (like a pixel at ccoordinate 5,). 
Obviously it is not contained into the rectangle. The problem is that according to the code it is, because all conditions are true, in fact:
5<=5 is true
5+1>=5 is true
5<=6 is true
5+1>=6

Am I right?

data.body:

The gdx-setup example launch image is portrait, so I change all the launch image to Landscape
for example:
Default-Landscape-568h@2x.png  is 1334x640.
Default-Landscape.png  is 480x320
.......

When I use Application Loader to upload ipa, 

ERROR ITMS-90096: "Your binary is not optimized for iPhone 5 - New iPhone apps and app updates submitted must support the 4-inch display on iPhone 5 and must include a launch image referenced in the Info.plist under UILaunchImages with a UILaunchImageSize value set to {320, 568}. Launch images must be PNG files and located at the top-level of your bundle, or provided within each .lproj folder if you localize your launch images. Learn more about iPhone 5 support and app launch images by reviewing the 'iOS Human Interface Guidelines' at 'https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/UserExperience/Conceptual/MobileHIG/IconsImages/IconsImages.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40006556-CH14-SW5' and the 'iOS App Programming Guide' at 'https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/iPhone/Conceptual/iPhoneOSProgrammingGuide/App-RelatedResources/App-RelatedResources.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/TP40007072-CH6-SW12'."

Thanks!

data.title: Fixes problems with lossy image data when using premultiplied alpha on GWT for textures
data.body:
Fixes problem reported in #3782 and #3316.

Texture loading in the GWT backend makes use of the Pixmap class (as in the other backends). The GWT Pixmap is backed by a JavaScript Canvas element in order to make it mutable, as required by the Pixmap class. This is a problem since the round-trip to the Canvas in certain cases is lossy (as documented in the official specs), creating visual artifacts when using the alpha channel (see referenced tickets and supplied test case).

The PR proposes to delay the creation of the Canvas until absolutely necessary. In the typical texture loading case, there is no need for this extra representation, and we can just use the already created ImageElement when uploading the texture using OpenGL.

External users of the Pixmap class should be unaffected

data.title: Label not setting font scale to 1 (fixes #4232)
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/4232

data.title: Label setFontScale(1) doesn't set the BitmapFont scale to 1
data.body:
#### Issue details

Label setFontScale(int scale) doesn't work when the argument is 1. The Label font scaling implementation makes the assumption that the underlying BitmapFont scale is set to 1 so that if the Label fontScaleX and fontScaleY are set to 1, there's no need to set the scale on the underlying BitmapFont.

That assumption is wrong as there are use cases in which it is useful to set the BitmapFont common scale to a value different than 1 and the use the specific Label's fontScale to scale each text.

Instead of comparing to 1, the implementation should compare the Label fontScaleX and fontScaleY with the BitmapFont scaleX and scaleY or, alternatively, keep a flag "fontScaleChanged" to be set to true if fontScale is modified and then use it to check if there's a need to change the BitmapFont's scale.

I will provide a PR when I get the chance. As a simple workaround in the meantime you can use setFontScale(0.9999f) instead.
#### Reproduction steps/code

SSCCE
http://pastebin.com/rsF6GDu2
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

1.9.3
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x] Android
- [x] iOS (robovm)
- [x] iOS (MOE)
- [x] HTML/GWT
- [x] Windows
- [x] Linux
- [x] MacOS

data.title: Problems to render Maps after camera.rotateAround with certain points
data.body:
#### Issue details

_ Sometimes the rotateAround method belonging to the Camera class is faulty in rendering OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer or TiledMapRenderer. I think it's a possible problem, otherwise I beg your pardon.

I came across the reported problem using the method in question in the game I'm trying to do. I thought it was something wrong with my code. Again went over my studies in Camera classes, OrthographicCamera and Viewport. Even redid the exercise of page

[https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Orthographic-camera](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Orthographic-camera)

I made the inclusion of 2 more conditions within the handleInput method to rotate the screen with the rotateAround method and there were no problems with the rendering of Sprite.

But when the rotation occurs when using OrthogonalTiledMapRenderer or TiledMapRenderer rendering is weird depending on the point chosen for the rotateAround.

I posted a video. I used as an example to play the SuperKoalio. I ran two examples choosing 2 different positions to rotate the camera. In the right window the rotation takes place and the floor disappears. In the left window its just perfectly.
 I had the same problem in my game as the right window.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v35rHSwZhLE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v35rHSwZhLE)
#### Reproduction steps/code

-To reproduce the error. I added the code line

`camera.rotateAround (new Vector3 (koala.position.x, koala.position.y, 0), new Vector3 (0,0,1), 1);`

after the updateKoala (deltaTime) within the render () method, after the line 131.
In the video example, the left screen that usually works the koala starting position on the line 116 remained the same.

`koala.position.set(20, 20);`

On the right screen the koala position was initiated with

`koala.position.set (30, 20);`

line 134 needs to be deleted to Koala be the center point.
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies

_Just tested with v9.3
#### Stacktrace

``` java
//No stacktrace
```
#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x ] Android
- [?] iOS (robovm)
- [?] iOS (MOE)
- [?] HTML/GWT
- [ x] Windows
- [?] Linux
- [?] MacOS

Thank you. Libgdx is amazing!

data.title: LibGDX project doesn't build with Gradle version over 2.9
data.body: When trying to build the libGDX project from source using a Gradle version higher than **2.9** the following error message appears: `Error:Gradle version 2.2 is required. Current version is 2.10. If using the gradle wrapper, try editing the distributionUrl in /XXXXXX/git/libgdx/gradle/wrapper/gradle-wrapper.properties to gradle-2.2-all.zip.` This is because of a limitation on the version of the Android Gradle plugin (com.android.tools.build:gradle) that is set to **1.2.3**. The fix to support Gradle **2.10+** was introduced on version **1.5.0** of the Android plugin (this is the fix https://android.googlesource.com/platform/tools/base/+/b96ce169b385d006cfccc4c9f1e54ab47140f59d). But if we set the **com.android.tools.build:gradle** version to **1.5.0** a new error appears this time: `Error:(272, 0) Your project contains 2 or more modules with the same identification com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-box2d at ":extensions:gdx-box2d" and ":extensions:gdx-box2d:gdx-box2d". You must use different identification (either name or group) for each modules. Open File`` This error also appears just by setting the **com.android.tools.build:gradle** version to **1.3.0**. **So, if I haven't made a mistake on my tests of course, libGDX is currently stuck on pretty old versions of Gradle and Android Gradle plugin versions until a fix for the box2d modules is found.** Also it looks like the information on the versions page regarding the Android Gradle plugin is not correct https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/versions.html.

data.title: Add HitMode to Group to allow choosing the hit detection strategy
data.body:
When multiple actors are added to a group, the one that gets returned by the hit method is the first one in the children hierarchy.

I have a use case where the actor that should be returned when the screen is touched is the one nearest to the hit coordinates (when two actors are partially superimposed, the current logic where the topmost actor is always returned feels unnatural when playing the game).

This pull request adds a HitMode option on the the Group class, that defaults to the current implementation and can be changed to a "nearest actor" mode.

data.title: Fix #4202
data.body:
The largest code point is 1,114,111, that's why I changed the format. (See http://unicode.org/faq/utf_bom.html#gen6  )
Previously only 6 digits were printed now 7 digits are printed and to be on the safe side I also included a space.  
So 

```
id=128512x
```

becomes 

```
id=128512  x
```

data.title: Added better cross-browser support for the visibilitychange event in GWT
data.body: Support the visibilitychange event on a wider range of desktop and mobile browsers

data.title: Enable custom no-support for WebGL widget
data.body: Enable the developer to return a custom widget when WebGL is not enabled. I have been using this to show helpful information, and links to help remedy the problem. It also makes it possible to localize the message.

data.title: Added Web Audio API support to GWT backend
data.body:
Has to be enabled in GwtApplicationConfiguration for now. It removes the dependency on SoundManager2, and has the following benefits:
1. Low latency sound on all browsers, including mobile
2. Simultaneous playback of multiple sounds on all browsers, including mobile
3. Support for pitch and pan on the GWT backend
4. Support for pausing audio when switching tabs

To test it using the gdx-tests, remember to alter your GwtTestStarter to enable the new code:
gwtApplicationConfiguration.preferWebAudioAPI = true;
gwtApplicationConfiguration.autoMuteOnPause = true;

I hope this, a modified version of this, or some other implementation of the Web Audio API can get merged, since the old SoundManager2 system is inadequate on mobile, in my experience.

Anyone adopting it should/could then go ahead and remove the inclusion of the SoundManager2 javascript files from the HTML pages.

Depending on whether this stuff can somehow be merged, I hope to follow up with better handling of preloading of sound/music on the GWT backend so we can get complete feature parity with the native platforms.

data.title: Always respect explicit row() calls (fixes #4183)
data.body: If the user calls row() it can be assumed the user definitely wants a new row. #4183 describes a case where this is needed.
